result.execSummary:
The defendant Cher Hai Cha was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Force [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in full time employment, schooling, or combination of the two, when not fully engaged complete 10 hours community service per week.
No contact with M.C.T. unless approved by agent.

Complete SAFE program intake and any follow through.
Complete any assessment, treatments, or counseling as deemed necessary by agent.
Register as Sex Offender for life.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: w/ huber for work or treatment if eligible.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cher Hai Cha

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 11:26am
INCLUDES 14CF433, 15CF657, 15CM383
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner.  Deft appears with Atty Peter Rotter.

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
14CF433:
Ct. 2 Sex with child age 16 or older >> D&RI
15CF657:
Ct. 2 Bail Jumping- Felony >> D&RI
Ct. 3 Batter- domestic abuse >> D&RI
Ct. 5 Bail Jumping- Misdemeanor >> D&RI
15CM383:
Ct. 1 Possess Drug Paraphernalia >> D&RI
COURT grants above

PLEA: 
14CF433:
Ct. 1 2nd degree sexual assault of child >> GUILTY
15CF657:
Ct. 1 Intimidate victim/use of attempt force- domestic abuse >> GUILTY
Ct. 4 Disorderly Conduct- domestic abuse >> GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & deft guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: On each count- 14CF433 Ct. 1 & 15CF657 Ct. 1: w/hold sentencing. 3 years probation, 15CF657 Ct. 4: 2 year probation . 15CF657 Ct. 1- 6 months MCJ, with huber for work or treatment if meets jail criteria. CONDITIONS of all three counts: Complete SAFE program intake and any follow through. Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. No contact with M.C.T., unless approved by agent. Register on sex offender registry for lifetime. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two, when not fully engaged complete 10 hours of community service per week. Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. Pay two domestic abuse surcharges. Cash bond posted be returned to poster. 

Atty Rotter to provide stipulation on jail credit to court

Adj: 11:46am

AMENDED No contact with victim(s):  M.C.T. non-waivable EXCEPT defendant may use Family Wizard for communications regarding child.  Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.  3rd party visitation through Family Resource Center.

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 3:31pm
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner; Deft appears in person with Atty Peter Rotter. Other apperances: Victim M.C.T.
Date and time set for motion to modify bond and lift no contact condition with victim

Atty Rotter has filed motion regarding the no contact to be lifted because of child visitation
State is opposing any modification from no contact with victim
State is not opposing third party to help with transporation of child to family resource center
Victim states from back she would like to waive the no contact
COURT addresses victims request and asks if third party can bring child to family resource center for child exchange
Victim does not have third party to assist in transportation of child to family resource center
Atty Rotter makes statement

COURT ORDERS: modifies bond to use family wizard for communication of child and no contact order with victim to remain in effect
Atty Rotter asks if communication from defendent and victim can be through text messages or phone calls
State disagrees with Atty Rotter's request
COURT asks if defendent is able to use family wizard for communication between parties
COURT modifies bond to use family wizard for communication of child

Dates: set future dates with Br 1 JA

Adj: 3:45pm
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Release From Conditions of Bond - stj
Mtn to Modify Bond by Defense & Hrg to Lift No Contact (victim) 10/13/15 @ 3:30pm
Sent to Judge - re: no contact
Defendant's -   and Demand for Discovery & Inspection and Extension - stj
Consent and Order for Substitution of Attorneys - includes 14CF433, 15CM383, 15CF657

Adj: 10:16 AM

Preliminary Hearing at 07-29-2015 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference at 08-26-2015 02:30 pm.

No contact with victim(s):  M.C.T. non-waivable.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.  3rd party visitation through Family Resource Center.
